Package io.github.eutro.jwasm

Interface ByteInputStream<E extends java.lang.Exception>

Type Parameters:
E - The exception that may be thrown by reads.
All Known Implementing Classes:
ByteInputStream.ByteBufferByteInputStream, ByteInputStream.InputStreamByteInputStream, ByteInputStream.SectionInputStream
public interface ByteInputStream<E extends java.lang.Exception>
An interface for WebAssembly bytecode sources, with methods for reading common WebAssembly types, such as LEB128 encoded numbers.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Interface Description
    static class  ByteInputStream.ByteBufferByteInputStream
    A ByteInputStream that reads from a ByteBuffer.
    static class  ByteInputStream.InputStreamByteInputStream
    A ByteInputStream that reads from an InputStream.
    static class  ByteInputStream.SectionInputStream<E extends java.lang.Exception>
    A section of a stream, as returned by sectionStream(int).

  • Method Details

    • get

      int get() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Get a single unsigned byte from the stream.
      Returns:
      An unsigned byte b (0x00 &lt;= b &lt;= 0xFF), or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.

    • get

      default int get​(byte[] buf, int offset, int len) throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Get bytes in bulk from the stream.

      Defaults to repeatedly getting bytes with get().

      Parameters:
      buf - The byte array to copy to.
      offset - The offset in buf to start writing at.
      len - The length of bytes to copy at most.
      Returns:
      The number of bytes gotten, or -1 if the end of stream had been reached.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If offset</code> is negative, or <code>len + offset exceeds buf.length.

    • skip

      default int skip​(int count) throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Skip a number of bytes from the stream, terminating early if the end of the stream is reached.

      Defaults to repeatedly getting bytes with get().

      Parameters:
      count - The number of bytes to skip.
      Returns:
      How many bytes were skipped.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.

    • skipAll

      default void skipAll() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Skip all the remaining bytes in the stream.

      Defaults to calling skip(int) with Integer.MAX_VALUE.

      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.

    • expect

      default byte expect() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Get a byte from the stream, throwing a ValidationException if the end of the stream was reached.
      Returns:
      The byte that was read.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      ValidationException - If the end of the stream was reached.

    • expectEmpty

      default void expectEmpty() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Expect the stream to be empty, throwing a ValidationException if it is not.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      ValidationException - If the end of the had not been reached.

    • getUInt32

      default int getUInt32() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Gets a 32 bit unsigned integer from the stream, in little endian byte order, throwing an exception if there aren't enough bytes in the stream.
      Returns:
      The unsigned integer interpreted from the next 4 bytes in the stream.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      ValidationException - If there are less than 4 bytes left in the stream.

    • getFloat32

      default float getFloat32() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Gets a 32 bit floating point value from the stream, in little endian byte order, throwing an exception if there aren't enough bytes in the stream.
      Returns:
      The floating point value interpreted from the next 4 bytes in the stream.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      ValidationException - If there are less than 4 bytes left in the stream.

    • getFloat64

      default double getFloat64() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Gets a 64 bit floating point value from the stream, in little endian byte order, throwing an exception if there aren't enough bytes in the stream.
      Returns:
      The floating point value interpreted from the next 8 bytes in the stream.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      ValidationException - If there are less than 8 bytes left in the stream.

    • getVarUInt32

      default int getVarUInt32() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Gets an LEB128 encoded unsigned integer from the stream, throwing an exception if the stream ends before the full integer is read, or if the number excedes 5 bytes.
      Returns:
      The integer that was read.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      ValidationException - If the stream ends before the number is fully read.
      ValidationException - If the number excedes 5 bytes.

    • getVarUIntX

      default long getVarUIntX​(int bytes) throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Gets an LEB128 encoded unsigned integer from the stream, throwing an exception if the stream ends before the full integer is read, or if the number excedes bytes bytes.
      Parameters:
      bytes - The maximum number of bytes to read.
      Returns:
      The integer that was read.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      ValidationException - If the stream ends before the number is fully read.
      ValidationException - If the number excedes bytes bytes.

    • getVarSInt32

      default int getVarSInt32() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Gets an LEB128 encoded signed integer from the stream, throwing an exception if the stream ends before the full integer is read, or if the number excedes 5 bytes.
      Returns:
      The integer that was read.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      ValidationException - If the stream ends before the number is fully read.
      ValidationException - If the number excedes 5 bytes.

    • getVarSInt64

      default long getVarSInt64() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Gets an LEB128 encoded signed integer from the stream, throwing an exception if the stream ends before the full integer is read, or if the number excedes 10 bytes.
      Returns:
      The integer that was read.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      ValidationException - If the stream ends before the number is fully read.
      ValidationException - If the number excedes 10 bytes.

    • getVarSIntX

      default long getVarSIntX​(int bytes) throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Gets an LEB128 encoded signed integer from the stream, throwing an exception if the stream ends before the full integer is read, or if the number excedes bytes bytes.
      Parameters:
      bytes - The maximum number of bytes to read.
      Returns:
      The integer that was read.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      ValidationException - If the stream ends before the number is fully read.
      ValidationException - If the number excedes bytes bytes.

    • getVarSIntX0

      default long getVarSIntX0​(int bytes, long v, int count) throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Gets the rest of an LEB128 encoded signed integer from the stream, throwing an exception if the stream ends before the full integer is read, or if the number excedes bytes bytes.

      This may be used if part of the number is already read before this is called.

      Parameters:
      bytes - The maximum number of bytes to read.
      v - The LEB128 encoded signed integer that has been read so far.
      count - How many bytes have already been read.
      Returns:
      The integer that was read.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      ValidationException - If the stream ends before the number is fully read.
      ValidationException - If the number excedes bytes bytes.

    • getBlockType

      default int getBlockType() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Get a WebAssembly blocktype</code> from the stream, which may be 0x40, a <code>valtype or a positive signed 33 bit integer.
      Returns:
      The blocktype that was read.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.

    • getByteArray

      default byte[] getByteArray() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Read a vector of bytes from the stream.

      This reads a size followed immediately by size bytes.

      Returns:
      The byte array that was read.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      ValidationException - If there aren't size bytes to read after size itself is read.

    • getName

      default java.lang.String getName() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Read a UTF-8 string (WebAssembly name) from the stream.

      This reads a byte array and interprets it as a string of UTF-8 characters.

      Returns:
      The string that was read.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      ValidationException - If the bytes aren't valid UTF-8.

    • getLimits

      default Limits getLimits() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Read a WebAssembly limit from the stream, which is a minimum and an optional maximum.
      Returns:
      A Limits value read from the stream.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      ValidationException - If the limit type wasn't recognised.

    • sectionStream

      default ByteInputStream<E> sectionStream() throws E extends java.lang.Exception
      Get a view of this stream from which getVarUInt32() bytes of this stream can be read.
      Returns:
      The new stream.
      Throws:
      E - If a read error occured.
      See Also:
      sectionStream(int)

    • sectionStream

      default ByteInputStream<E> sectionStream​(int length)
      Get a view of this stream from which length bytes of this stream can be read.

      Reading bytes from the returned stream will read bytes from the original stream.

      Reading beyond this limit will report that the end of the stream has been reached.

      Parameters:
      length - How many bytes the stream should see.
      Returns:
      The new stream.
